intro: Calyptranthes spruceana, commonly known as the mountain calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and often have a glossy appearance. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are clustered in racemose inflorescences, adding ornamental value to the plant.
